New Records: South Africa bowled Sri Lanka out for their lowest total in men's T20Is.
Anrich Nortje posted career-best figures of 4/7 in T20Is.
Key Match Events: Ottneil Baartman took a wicket with his very first ball and conceded just nine runs from his four overs.
Anrich Nortje took 4 wickets for 7 runs from 4 overs.
Quinton de Kock anchored the chase with 20 from 27 balls.
Nuwan Thushara and Dasun Shanaka made powerplay breakthroughs for Sri Lanka.
Wanindu Hasaranga took two wickets to remove Quinton de Kock and Tristan Stubbs.
Heinrich Klaasen and David Miller completed the chase with 3.4 overs and six wickets to spare.
Pre-Game Insights: Sri Lanka won the toss and elected to bat first.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was the first ICC Men’s T20 World Cup 2024 game to be held in New York.
Sri Lanka will resume their Group D campaign against Bangladesh in Dallas on Saturday 8 June.
South Africa will play the Netherlands in New York on the same day.
